name: Slow-Cooker Mexican Beef With Lime Crema and Pinto Beans
description: Comforting Mexican pot roast is prepared in the slow cooker with saucy beans.
recipeIngredient: 3 pounds boneless bottom round or chuck roast (in one whole piece)
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 cup dried pinto beans, well-rinsed and picked over
1 (28-ounce) can whole tomatoes, preferably San Marzano, crushed by hand
1 cup low-sodium beef broth, plus additional as needed
1 cup sour cream, preferably Mexican crema

recipeInstructions.text: Place meat in the slow cooker and add garlic, onion, jalapenos, beans, tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, bay leaves, Worcestershire sauce, vinegar, beef broth, and tequila. Season with about a teaspoon of salt. Cook on low until beef is tender and beans are cooked, 8 to 10 hours, adding additional broth as needed to keep beans saturated and submerged.
Mix sour cream with lime juice and cilantro in a small bowl. When beans are tender and pot roast yields to a fork, taste and adjust seasonings. Serve meat and beans with warm tortillas and crema.
